availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Henry Payne (Bowling Green, KY, attorney and judge)

body.p: Bowling Green, Warren County, Kentucky, attorney and county judge. Fairfax County, Virginia native. Son of Edmund Payne and Catherine T. Hawley Payne. Married to Lucy Loving Payne in c1839. Married to Euphemia Y. Stubbins Payne in 1846. Studied law from 1835 to 1837. Miller in Warren County in 1850. Judge of Warren County Court in 1850. Lumberman in Warren County in 1860. Attorney in Bowling Green in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 24B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, District 2, p. 594.
Thomas W. Westerfield, ed., Kentucky Genealogy and Biography, Volume II (Owensboro, KY: Genealogical Reference Company, 1971), 196.
